title: Scrolling Issue
content:
Firefox has been my default browser for many years. My OS is Windows 10. Starting about a month ago, when scrolling through my feed on Facebook, as I get low on the scroll bar, the the feed starts scrolling rapidly on its own. I suspected a problem with my mouse, but a replacement mouse didn't help. Keyboard next, but that's not it either. I then looked at my FB feed using MS Edge. It did not have the problem.

Thinking my Firefox installation might have gotten corrupted, I uninstalled FF, rebooted the computer, obtained a fresh install from the Mozilla website and reinstalled. Same problem.

I prefer Firefox, but I am now opening Facebook using MS Edge to avoid the issue.

Any ideas ????

Thank you.

George Butch Plantation, FL
creator: gbutch

title: Firefox BLOCK Auto-Play
content:
Hi, I have Autoplay disabled in the firefox settings, however as most people will know a lot of websites circumnavigate this becasue they know better then me.

The below website "Twitter" refuses to acknowledge my "settings" https://twitter.com/search?src=typed_query&q=%23ukraine

Why can't Firefox fix this? Why have settings if websites can just ignore them?? Also another thing, Autoplay dosen't make any sense to me, if you wan't to watch the full video, you have to first turn on sound, and then move the slider bar the the start. This is stupid! Just let the user choose if they would like to have videos autoplay or not. I hate the internet.

One more thing, I do realize there is a setting in Twitter to disable autoplay, however you need to be logged in for that option to be available. Websites should just repesct the settings of there webusers. Thants why "global settings' exist. Unfortunately just another redisculous control feature of the modern internet.

Thank you for reading and or helping.
creator: ThankYou88

title: Velocidad de descarga lenta
content: buenas noches escribo por que tengo 80 megas pero mis descargas son lentas, antes descargaba en 5 minutos ahora me demoro 25 minutos, el problema sucedio cuando mi firefox se actualizo a la version 102.0.1 por accidente pero mi pc viejita siempre tuvo una version antigua ya sea la 80 o la 86, asi que cuando volvi a esas versiones antiguas se cambio algo en mi configuracion y mi descarga se puso lenta, no es mi internet ni las paginas puesto que en una notebook si descarga muy rapido, por favor si alguien pueda ayudarme estare eternamente agradecido

title: Quality problem with streamed video and varying blur
content:
I've been using Firefox on Windows 10/11 to stream video from a streaming service (BritBox). The image quality varies during a show, regularly appearing more blurry for a few seconds and then improving again. There are also regular flashes which I think are between scenes.

I spent the weekend upgrading the computer (it was long overdue) hoping that it might fix the problem but it didn't.

Last night I decided to try Microsoft Edge. Not only was there no variation of blurriness and no flashes, the video images were way way sharper.

What's going on here please? Is there an add-in to provide better quality streaming?
creator: dhanslip

title: Removing a website from a multi-account container site list
content:
Hello,

I'm using the Multi-Account Containers add-on and for the most part I am quite happy with it. However, a month or two ago I accidentally added a website to one of my containers, and since then I have found it impossible to remove. If I remove it from the container's site list, it just shows back up again shortly after.

I do have sync enabled for the add-on and I am logged in on 3 different devices. However, I have tried to remove the website from the container simultaneously on all my devices, but the problem still persists.

Is there any viable way to actually remove a website from a container's site list, or do I have to resort to more extreme measures like deleting the container itself?

Thanks for you help!
creator: corywilson1993
